data.text: @UlsterExec The weather will also be warmer and our children can be outdoors more which we all know helps prevent transmission.

@UlsterExec The smart thing to do is extend mask mandates in schools through the end of March. How many times have we had a lull and eased restriction during this pandemic to only have a new surge? Are we not learning from past mistakes?
@UlsterExec So parents with children 5 and under are on their own now?
@UlsterExec Thank you for all your good work & keeping us informed @UlsterExec 🙏🏼
@UlsterExec @DailyFreeman If you value your job, you will never pull this tyranny again.
@UlsterExec LIAR and FRAUD. Been pushing POLITICAL SCIENCE from the start. But, you got your $$$ from the Blue State Bailouts. All is good now.

In line with NYS decision to lift the mask requirement for children two years & up, and based on the CDC placing Ulster County in the “Low” COVID-19 Community Level, children in Ulster two years old and over will no longer be required to wear masks indoors effective March 2. 2/2
